title: Katherine Musallam Environmental science-Erosion and ranching practices   Feb. 18-22

subtasks: Examine the concept of erosion and its causes
Explain the role of plants in soil conservation
Describe intercropping as a method to prevent erosion
Explain crop rotation and its benefits
Discuss the use of shelter belts in reducing wind erosion
Describe contour farming and its applications
Define ranching and its relation to livestock management
Analyze the effects of overgrazing on soil
Discuss the role of range managers in controlling overgrazing
Examine the consequences of overgrazing on soil structure and vegetation
Summarize the factors affecting soil degradation
Identify methods to conserve soil and prevent erosion
Understand the importance of sustainable farming practices
Connect erosion control methods to real-life applications
